explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions using machine learning approaches to predict lapses in mortgage life insurance.
explanations.supervised learning: The predictive models used (Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Neural Networks, XGBoost) are all supervised learning techniques.
explanations.classification: The task of predicting policy lapses is a classification problem, where the model classifies policies as at risk of lapse or not.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions using Neural Networks as one of the machine learning models investigated.
explanations.XGBoost: The paper states that XGBoost outperformed other models in their study.
explanations.Logistic Regression: Logistic Regression is listed as one of the machine learning models used in the study.
explanations.Random Forest: Random Forest is listed as one of the machine learning models used in the study.
explanations.SHAP: SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP) were used to enhance the interpretability of the predictive model.
